title: Sueño 2014 Tempranillo (Ribera del Júcar)
description: This wine's ripe berry aromas include integrated oak, tar and vanilla notes. Its plum, raspberry, vanilla and cream flavors are appealing, yet it finishes raw, jagged and a bit shrill.

title: Sweetzer Cellars 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Broad red and black plum aromas meet thyme and Earl Grey touches on the nose of this county blend from a Los Angeles-based producer. The flavors are familiar and easy, with tart and tangy red fruit and a touch of caramelization on the finish.

title: Teliani Valley 2014 Mukuzani Saperavi (Kakheti)
description: This dark violet-red wine has a nose of blackberry and rose petal. Full on the palate, it offers flavors of black cherry, cranberry, chocolate and a touch of smoke. There is a pervading sense of brightness throughout, although sneaky tannins provide for a hint of chalkiness on the finish.

title: Loma Larga 2014 Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)
description: Edgy slightly sharp aromas of herbal berry fruits, olive and eucalyptus set up a tight rough palate. Big-time herbal flavors are oaky and taste of leafy black fruits and olive. This powerful Cab Franc finishes with woody notes of mint along with herbal berry and leftover eucalyptus nut flavors.

title: Seven Falls 2014 GPS Series Stone Tree Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)
description: High-toned aromas of spice, black fruit and red apple are followed by dark coffee and pitch-black cherry flavors that show a lot of barrel influence. There's enjoyment to be had but this wine seems a little heavy handed.

title: Three Rivers 2014 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Unique, high-toned aromas of freshly peeled orange, potpourri, clove and blue fruit lead to lighter styled, tart, plentiful plum flavors. This wine doesn't stand up on its own but should fit in well at the dinner table.

title: Don Tony Perez 2014 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
description: Pastry notes blend with ripe berry aromas and hints of vanilla and raisin. This is rubbery and tannic in feel, with flavors of cherry, plum, cassis and herbal spice. On the finish, an herbal flavor note is typical of Chilean Cabernet.

title: Doqi 2014 Qveri Kisi (Georgia)
description: Don't be fooled by this honey-colored wine's simple nose of clementine. It offers a complex palate of green apple, guava and honeydew melon bolstered by soft floral notes. Strong tannins make their presence known on the gums and tongue, but any sense of grippiness is overcome by the bright citrus finish.

title: WesMar 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light in color, with delicate raspberry and strawberry fruit, this is light-bodied and ethereal, quietly revealing pops of dried herb, clove and rose.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Añares Crianza  (Rioja)
description: The baked berry, raisin and vanilla aromas in this Tempranillo and Garnacha blend are a touch soupy. It's tannic and firm on the palate, with tomato, berry and mildly oxidized flavors.

title: 29 & Oak Wines 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With mild red fruit, baked plum accents and a lackluster structure, this wine, blended with 10% Merlot, is big and dense.

title: Animale 2014 Pinot Noir
description: Listed as well in excess of 15% alcohol, this is sourced from a single vineyard in a hot year. The grapes were left to hang while sugars rose precipitously. Flavors suggest mincemeat pie, brown sugar and root beer. Not typical, but tasty enough. Drink over the next year for peak flavor.

title: Auclair 2014 Right Blend Artz Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)
description: Merlot and Cabernet Franc make up equal parts of this blend. Aromas are up front, with notes of baking spice, dates, anise and slightly dried-out fruit. Dark-cherry flavors bring a sense of concentration and enjoyment.

title: Cherry Tart 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: Big and flavorful, this full-bodied wine boasts butter, toast and smoke nuances layered over ripe pear and marzipan flavors. Fermented in stainless steel but aged in French oak, it has a rich texture and overt sweetness without going to extremes.

title: Child's Play 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a pretty wine, forward and fruit-driven, with orange-juice highlights around cherry fruit. It's as fresh and flavorful as a Cru Beaujolais, ready for immediate enjoyment and best consumed sometime this decade.

title: Contrada Salandra 2014 Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)
description: Citrus zest, toasted nut, Mediterranean scrub and honey aromas follow over to the refined palate along with yellow apple and a hint of ginger. Bright acidity and a saline note give it a fresh, savory finish.

title: Love That Red 2014 Daily Double Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Franc makes up half this wine, with the balance Cabernet Sauvignon (33%) and Merlot. Plum, blueberry, blackberry and baking-spice aromas lead to a fruit-filled palate with light barrel accents throughout.

title: Fog Crest 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Fragrant and floral with exotic figueroa, orange and peach scents, this wine is a feast for the senses, playing out on the palate with high-toned acidity, anise flavor and oak.

title: Primus 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Woodsy earthy black-fruit, raisin and spice-cake aromas are ripe. On the palate, this is chewy, tannic and rubbing. Roasted plum and berry flavors come with notes of toast, chocolate and herbs. A dense grabby finish is solid but a touch hot and rough.

title: Maquis 2014 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Rubbery black-fruit aromas come with a distinct and strong whiff of bacon. In the mouth, this is full, angular and highly tannic. A bacon-like flavor leads plum and saucy tomato notes, while this is chunky and scrubbing on the finish, with a flavor of clove.

title: Lincourt 2014 Steel Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Crisp and citrusy lime peel, grapefruit pith, orange and nectarine aromas show in this stainless steel-aged bottling. The palate is more botanical in nature, showing chive and dill along with underripe Bosc pear and key lime flavors. The texture is quite grippy.

title: LangeTwins 2014 Red Tail Vineyard Nero d'Avola (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine is worth exploring. It's made from a grape variety popular in Italy and has attractive earth and sage aromas and cherry flavors liberally sprinkled with mineral and leather accents. A light coating of tannins boosts the mouthfeel.

title: Pedroncelli 2014 Mother Clone Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Smoky leather and cedar notes rest on a brawny foundation of bold, dry tannin and generous black fruit in this dusty wine. Full-bodied and dense, it opens to show additional tobacco and chocolate aspects.

title: Rutherford Hill 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Punchy red fruit meets brawny tannin and substantial oak in this red, which includes small amounts of Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Its cherry and cassis notes are seasoned with dried herb highlights.

title: Seven Falls 2014 GPS Series Mracheck Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)
description: Baking spice, vanilla and dark-fruit aromas are followed by dark cherry and coffee flavors that linger on the finish. The barrel influence seems a little intense.

title: Seven Hills 2014 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of moist earth, black fruit, pencil lead and slightly overripe red apple are followed by a firm palate backed by lightly grippy tannins. This wine needs some food to keep them in check.

title: Soos Creek 2014 Artist Series #14 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is 62% Cabernet Sauvignon and 38% Cabernet Franc. Barrel aromas are at the fore, with baking spice, woodspice and clove in front of dark fruit and herb. The palate brings sweet, sappy fruit flavors, with plentiful licorice and game accents.

title: William Church 2014 Keystone Series Lewis Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of cola, herb, barrel spice and cherry lead to plentiful cola flavors. The palate brings some heft but the tannins possess a slight sense of grittiness that distracts.

title: Sweetzer Cellars 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Lemon curd, white peach and tangerine aromas make for a nicely rounded nose in this appellation blend. It's a very familiar Chardonnay expression on the palate, with a citrus edge that cuts through ripe pear and sea salt flavors. The mouthfeel shows chalky tension.

title: Sanguinhal 2014 Quinta de S. Francisco Red (Obidos)
description: Situated close to the picturesque hilltop town of Obidos, this quinta has produced a ripe full-bodied wine. With bold red fruits, juicy acidity and a layer of tannins, the wine is both generous and fruity. It will be ready to drink from late 2017.
